metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26081 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Epiphany (aka GNOME Web) through 43.0, untrusted web content can trick users into exfiltrating passwords, because autofill occurs in sandboxed contexts.

criterions.comment: epiphany-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
